message.content:
cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.DL, cs.SOC, cs.HC. 

The paper discusses the usage and motivations of academics using an academic social networking service, which involves aspects of computer science (cs.CY) such as designing and implementing the platform, as well as social informatics (cs.SI) in terms of studying the social practices and behaviors of users. The paper also touches on digital libraries (cs.DL) as the platform used for the case study is Mendeley, a reference management tool. Additionally, the paper explores the social aspects of scholarly communication (cs.SOC) and the design of the platform for user participation (cs.HC).
